@Mamoon69 it is apparent that it is you who knows nothing about rating release quality.

First BDRip is not indicative of quality, it is merely the source of the rip. A BDRip could be worse or better than a DVDrip, it is entirely dependant on the settings used by the encoder. Same goes for '720p', this simply refers to the resolution! Not the actual quality of the picture.

Second, the fact that you would recommend a crappy FXG release over this excellent release...well perhaps you shouldn't be commenting on torrents at all you are simply misleading everyone else!!

This film is meant to be grainy, it's intentional. And this is a very good release. 10/10
